TypeSignature.Value: .class nested public auto ansi abstract sealed beforefieldinit VisualStyleElement/MenuBand/NewApplicationButton extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Provides objects for each state of the new application button of a menu band. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Each property of the VisualStyleElement.MenuBand.NewApplicationButton class returns a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> for a different state of the new application button of a menu band.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer> with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement.MenuBand.NewApplicationButton.Normal%2A> property. To run this example, paste it into a Windows Form. Handle the form’s <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event and call the `DrawVisualStyleElementMenuBandNewApplicationButton1` method from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event-handling method, passing `e` as <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs>.
[!code-cs[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#186](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/278befd0-0ae3-4d74-a49d-_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#186](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/278befd0-0ae3-4d74-a49d-_1.vb)]

Docs.summary: Gets a visual style element that represents the new application button in the checked state.
Docs.value: A that represents the new application button in the checked state.

remarks.format:
## Remarks You can use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the Checked property to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer>.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer> with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the Checked property. To run this example, paste it into a Windows Form. Handle the form’s <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event and call the `DrawVisualStyleElementMenuBandNewApplicationButton5` method from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event-handling method, passing `e` as <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs>.
[!code-cs[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#190](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/82a228d1-8fab-49a1-81f3-_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#190](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/82a228d1-8fab-49a1-81f3-_1.vb)]

Docs.value: A that represents the new application button in the hot state.
